title: 115_s62
content: The Act may be cited as the "January 8th National Memorial Act" and includes findings. The tragedy of January 8, 2011, at Congresswoman Gabrielle Gifford's ``Congress on Your Corner'' event resulted in the deaths of 6 people and injury of 13 others, including Congresswoman Giffords. It was the first assassination attempt on a Congressional Member during a constituent meeting. Giffords sustained severe injuries that still affect her today. Gabe Zimmerman was the first Congressional staffer to be killed in the attack. The Arizona community and people from around the world came together in the days following the tragedy to provide comfort and support at three memorial vigil sites. Tucson's January 8th Memorial will honor those who died and the response to the tragedy. Tucson's January 8th Memorial will pay tribute to the victims of the tragedy and showcase the community's resilience and democracy's strength in the United States. The January 8th National Memorial in Tucson honors the victims of a tragedy and symbolizes the community's resilience and democracy's strength in the United States. The January 8th National Memorial in Tucson, established by the Secretary of the Interior, is affiliated with the National Park System. The Memorial is defined as the January 8th National Memorial, and the Foundation responsible for it is the Tucson's January 8th Memorial Foundation, a tax-exempt organization. The Secretary will establish the Memorial as an affiliated area of the National Park System once the Foundation has complied with requirements including establishing a trust fund for donations and the construction, operation, maintenance, and management of the Memorial. The Memorial will consist of the area depicted as the "Memorial Boundary" on the map. The Foundation will be the management entity responsible for the construction, operation, maintenance, and management of the Memorial. If the Foundation fails to comply with the requirements, the Memorial will cease to be an affiliated area of the National Park System. The map depicting the "Memorial Boundary" will be available for reference. The Secretary may provide technical assistance and enter into cooperative agreements with the Foundation for financial assistance with marketing the Memorial. The Secretary is not authorized to acquire property or use Federal funds for the Memorial's construction, operation, maintenance, or management. A general management plan will be developed by the Secretary in consultation with the Foundation. The Secretary, in consultation with the Foundation, will develop a general management plan for the Memorial in accordance with specified regulations. The plan must be provided to relevant congressional committees within 3 years of funds availability or Memorial establishment.
